name: Clarence FORTNEY, t/d/b/a Fortney's Garden Center, Appellant, v. BELL TELEPHONE OF PENNSYLVANIA and Counties Contracting and Construction Company

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
parties: Clarence FORTNEY, t/d/b/a Fortney’s Garden Center, Appellant, v. BELL TELEPHONE OF PENNSYLVANIA and Counties Contracting and Construction Company.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted, 267 Pa.Super. 576, 407 A.2d 391.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Daniel M. Pell, York, for appellant.
William F. Martson, Daniel K. Deardorff, Carlisle, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
424 A.2d 500
Clarence FORTNEY, t/d/b/a Fortney’s Garden Center, Appellant, v. BELL TELEPHONE OF PENNSYLVANIA and Counties Contracting and Construction Company.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 14, 1980.
Decided Jan. 27, 1981.
Daniel M. Pell, York, for appellant.
William F. Martson, Daniel K. Deardorff, Carlisle, for appellee.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
